gps_emulator.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 """!@brief Script to emulate a GPS signal for other nodes.
4 
5 @details As of this point, ROS Noetic does not support the Hector GPS plugin. Instead, this module makes use of the
6 ground truth position data from the robot and republishes it with additional gaussian noise. In order to emulate a
7 GPS, the conversion function for the particular simulation still has to be implemented. The logic behind this module is
8 that other nodes on the robot receive a pseudo GPS signal to work with in their localization algorithms. This signal
9 can't be provided from outside, so the robot itself publishes a noisy estimation of what a GPS signal would look like on
10 its current position.
11 
12 @file gps_emulator.py GPSEmulator class and node script.
13 
14 @author Martin Schuck
15 
16 @date 19.09.2020
17 """
18 
19 
20 from pathlib import Path
21 import numpy as np
22 import yaml
23 
24 import rospy
25 from nav_msgs.msg import Odometry
26 
27 
28 class GPSEmulator:
29  """!@brief Contains the logic for GPS emulation.
30 
31  @details The DynamicLightLoader makes use of the published ground truth position data. This data is assumed to be
32  published at ROS topic: "/ground_truth/odom". The GPS signal is then published under "/tas_car/gps".
33 
34  @note If there is no ground truth data, just add the P3D Gazebo plugin to your URDF file.
35  """
36 
37  def __init__(self):
38  """!@brief GPSEmulator constructor.
39 
40  @details Initializes the ROS node and sets up the subscriber/publisher. Also loads the config for the GPS noise.
41  """
42  rospy.init_node('GPSEmulator', anonymous=True)
43  self.position_mean = [0.0, 0.0]
44  self.position_sigma = 0.0
45  self.orientation_mean = 0.0
46  self.orientation_sigma = 0.0
47  self.linear_velocity_mean = [0.0, 0.0]
48  self.linear_velocity_sigma = 0.0
49  self.angular_velocity_mean = 0.0
50  self.angular_velocity_sigma = 0.0
51  self.load_config()
52  self.start_callback = False
53  self.ground_truth_subscriber = rospy.Subscriber("/ground_truth/odom", Odometry, self._odometry_callback)
54  self.gps_publisher = rospy.Publisher("/tas_car/gps", Odometry, queue_size=1)
55 
56  def load_config(self):
57  """!@brief Loads the config file for the GPS noise.
58 
59  @details The file can be found in the robot_sim/config/gps_emulator.yaml file. Edit the entries as necessary.
60 
61  @warning The yaml file is not checked for correctness of data types. Please only edit existing entries.
62  """
63  path = Path(__file__).resolve().parent.parent.joinpath('config', 'gps_emulator.yaml')
64  try:
65  with open(path, 'r') as f:
66  config = yaml.safe_load(f)
67  self.position_mean = config['position']['mean']
68  self.position_sigma = config['position']['sigma']
69  self.orientation_mean = config['orientation']['mean']
70  self.orientation_sigma = config['orientation']['sigma']
71  self.linear_velocity_mean = config['linear_velocity']['mean']
72  self.linear_velocity_sigma = config['linear_velocity']['sigma']
73  self.angular_velocity_mean = config['angular_velocity']['mean']
74  self.angular_velocity_sigma = config['angular_velocity']['sigma']
75  rospy.loginfo('GPS emulator successfully applied GPS config.')
76  except (FileNotFoundError, yaml.scanner.ScannerError):
77  rospy.logwarn('GPS emulator file missing or malformed!')
78  rospy.loginfo('Config not available, reverting to default.')
79 
80  def _odometry_callback(self, odom):
81  """!@brief Callback for the ground truth subscriber.
82 
83  @details Adds noise to the received odometry data and republishes it. Also converts the odometry to a proper GPS
84  signal if _odom_to_gps_conversion is implemented.
85 
86  @param odom ROS Odometry message from the subscriber.
87  """
88  if self.start_callback:
89  odom.pose.pose.position.x += np.random.randn(1)*self.position_sigma + self.position_mean[0]
90  odom.pose.pose.position.y += np.random.randn(1)*self.position_sigma + self.position_mean[1]
91  odom.pose.pose.orientation.z += np.random.randn(1)*self.orientation_sigma + self.orientation_mean
92  odom.twist.twist.linear.x += np.random.randn(1)*self.linear_velocity_sigma + self.linear_velocity_mean[0]
93  odom.twist.twist.linear.y += np.random.randn(1)*self.linear_velocity_sigma + self.linear_velocity_mean[1]
94  odom.twist.twist.angular.z += np.random.randn(1)*self.angular_velocity_sigma + self.angular_velocity_mean
95  try:
96  odom = self._odom_to_gps_conversion(odom)
97  except NotImplementedError:
98  pass
99  self.gps_publisher.publish(odom)
100 
101  @staticmethod
102  def _odom_to_gps_conversion(odom):
103  """!@brief Placeholder for the conversion to GPS.
104 
105  @details Implementing the function will automatically include it in _odometry_callback.
106  """
107  raise NotImplementedError
108 
109  def start(self):
110  """!@brief Starts the GPS emulator.
111 
112  @details Unlocks the odometry callback and keeps the node spinning.
113  """
114  rospy.loginfo('Started GPS emulator.')
115  self.start_callback = True
116  rospy.spin()
117 
118 
119 if __name__ == '__main__':
120  gps_emulator = GPSEmulator()
121  gps_emulator.start()
